image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: A parliamentary committee has heard $1.5 billion budgeted for water and waste infrastructure only covers pipelines for one of four land release sites in Adelaide, but the state government says the funding and timeline are going according to plan.

title.children: No water infrastructure funding for three land releases hoped to ease SA housing crisis

image.altText: CCTV screenshot of a man with a beard wearing a beanie and winter jacket inside a store next to shelving

props.synopsis: Police have launched a widespread search of South Australia's northern Flinders Ranges for a man in a rental van who arrived at Arkaroola Village but has not been seen for 11 days.

title.children: Police fear missing man in SA's Flinders Ranges is injured or stranded

image.altText: A woman smiles while she holds up some fabric.

props.synopsis: Regional fashion designers who source their fabrics from op shops, dead stock, and even off the sheep's back say they offer a more sustainable alternative to fast fashion.

title.children: Small designers struggle to compete in flooded fast-fashion market

image.altText: Close-up photo of a silver and white stethoscope. Dec 2022.

props.synopsis: A GP who used his position of trust to exploit a vulnerable patient — having sex with her and failing to provide adequate care — has had his registration cancelled for four years.

title.children: 'Selfish, cruel and calculated' GP banned over relationship with patient

image.altText: The side of a South Australian police car parked in a street.

props.synopsis: South Australian police have found three children who were reported missing safe and well.

title.children: Three SA children reported missing found safe and well

image.altText: GettyImages-2218919868

props.synopsis: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce become the first AFLW players to be inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame.

title.children: Footy star's emotional Hall of Fame speech leaves father in tears

image.altText: An emu standing outside the front door of a home.

props.synopsis: Residents are urged not to leave food and water out for the migrating wildlife despite worsening drought conditions.

title.children: Wildlife moves to built-up areas in search of food, water in drought

image.altText: Two officers with back to the camera and wearing jackets saying police ICE and HSI holding a man in cuffs

props.synopsis: A hacker who was responsible for one of the largest private breaches in Australia's history, has been arrested by the US immigration agency.

title.children: United States government says it will deport serial Australian hacker

image.altText: Three half empty wine glasses with a vineyard in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the world's largest producers believes it has cracked the code to keeping the taste of wine people want while removing the alcohol.

title.children: Wine giant claims taste breakthrough with no-alcohol wine

image.altText: A sign says "Toowong Private Hospital".

props.synopsis: The family-owned mental health facility has been under financial pressure and went into administration last month.

title.children: Struggling hospital bought artwork from director for $300K, documents show

image.altText: Members of Los Angeles police stand guard after curfew begins in downtown LA.

props.synopsis: Day five of immigration protests has ended in LA, but unrest has spread across the US, with the governor of Texas warning the National Guard is on its way in his state, too.

title.children: Police conduct mass arrests of protesters in downtown LA as curfew begins

image.altText: thumbnail la protest

props.synopsis: Local police, the California National Guard, and US Marines are trying to manage the LA protests. But if you're watching them happen in real time, how do you tell which is which?

title.children: How to tell police and military apart at the LA protests

image.altText: An illustration of army vehicles driving ashore from ferry-type green craft.

props.synopsis: Growing concern surrounds delays to a Western Australian project to build army water landing craft, amid fears other shipbuilding efforts could also be disrupted.

title.children: Uncertainty and delays loom over West Australian naval shipyard project

image.altText: A woman holding a sketch.

props.synopsis: Queer artists in South Australia's largest regional city hope having their art on public display will help other LGBTQIA+ people feel at home.

title.children: City's queer art trail helps creator 'feel safe to be myself'

image.altText: A man speaks in parliament

props.synopsis: Tasmanians will head to the polls in five weeks, after Governor Barbara Baker accepted the premier's request for an early election — the second in 15 months for the state.

title.children: Tasmanians to head to the polls as election called for Saturday July 19

image.altText: Q+A

props.synopsis: Launched in 2008, Q+A was an agenda-setting program that pushed politicians beyond their standard talking points.

title.children: ABC announces 40 redundancies in restructure that sees the end of Q+A

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: This snap election may well end 11 years of Liberal government in Tasmania. But in a state with a history of long-running Labor governments, it's far from clear if this election will usher in a new era of stable politics.

title.children: Will this election herald new era of stable politics? Don't bet on it

image.altText: Full moon

props.synopsis: The name isn't about the colour of the Moon — it refers to a time of the year in the Northern Hemisphere where fruits like strawberries are ripening.

title.children: Why tonight's 'strawberry moon' might not be pink

image.altText: Plastic bags full of white powder

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old was behind the controls of a so-called black flight carrying $17 million worth of methamphetamine into Queensland.

title.children: Pilot jailed for smuggling 56kg of drugs from PNG to Australia

image.altText: Man walks on Sydney street wearing a hat standing next to another man

props.synopsis: One of Gareth Ward's accusers tells a court he delayed reporting the NSW MP because his electorate "shouldn't pay the price", as the defence argues the alleged assault never happened.

title.children: Man delayed reporting alleged rape by MP to protect electorate, trial hears

image.altText: A film photograph of a mother in a blue shirt next to her younger daughter.

props.synopsis: Your parents are elderly, your kids need you, and it's up to you to tend to the needs of everyone. Welcome to the sandwich generation.

title.children: How the 'sandwich generation' juggles caring for children and grandparents

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal MP Moira Deeming offers to delay bankruptcy proceedings against former leader John Pesutto if the opposition party bypasses its rules and guarantees her preselection for next year's state election.

title.children: Deeming offers to delay Pesutto bankruptcy proceedings for preselection

image.altText: A silver-bearded man in a blue shirt stands in front of a driveway through pine trees.

props.synopsis: It was meant to be a run-of-the-mill auction with only one interested party, but then locals say nefarious actors turned up and prices soared.

title.children: Peter thought he owned his driveway until it was listed for auction

image.altText: A crew wearing orange life vests holds their hands up

props.synopsis: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition which organised the ship, claimed the activists, which included climate protester Greta Thunberg, were detained while sailing through international waters.

title.children: Israel is accused of seizing the Madleen in international waters. Can it do that?

image.altText: A woman's hand clasps an elderly person's had as it rests on a crocheted blanket.

props.synopsis: Annecto, which employs about 1,000 people and has 4,400 clients on its books, has announced it will close next month.

title.children: Major aged care and disability support service set to close

image.altText: A bald man with a white beard and red top sits at a table.

props.synopsis: John planned to live out his days at a caravan park but was issued an eviction notice after nearly two years. He took the case to the Supreme Court which has ruled the eviction attempt "invalid and of no effect".

title.children: Eviction notice for van park resident ruled invalid, judge blasts 'oppression'

image.altText: A a look inside terminal at Western Sydney Airport

props.synopsis: Despite Western Sydney International Airport being on track to open in late 2026, clarity on two stumbling blocks remain up in the air.

title.children: First look inside Australia's newest international airport as issues remain

image.altText: A sign saying stock hotel

props.synopsis: A judge says he considered the need to protect the community while sentencing a 28-year-old who doused another man in petrol outside a Toowoomba hotel.

title.children: Man involved in 'terrifying' petrol fire attack jailed for nine years

image.altText: Moody portrait of a man in a faulty social housing complex.

props.synopsis: A blistering audit finds the government agency tasked with managing Western Australia's water is "not doing anywhere near enough" to protect the resource amid a drying climate.

title.children: Four trillion litres of water extracted yearly in WA without proper oversight

image.altText: Jones on set watching McEvoy talking in microphone to audience.

props.synopsis: Q+A was a rarity in Australian television news history — a show led in part by its audience where anything could happen live on air. Here are some of the most memorable moments.

title.children: Toasters, thrown shoes and stand-offs: Q+A's most fiery moments

image.altText: Person holds microphone and sings into with very focused expression, on smoky stage.

props.synopsis: This powerhouse cabaret about the life and music of Divinyls rockstar Chrissy Amphlett doesn't shoot for imitation; rather it celebrates the trailblazing, rule-breaking musical legend.

title.children: This new show about rockstar Chrissy Amphlett does not hold back

image.altText: A cartoon shows four characters pointing various weapons in a game scenario at something out of frame

props.synopsis: Police are warning Hong Kong residents against downloading the Reversed Front: Bonfire mobile game, saying those who have installed the app may be seen as possessing a publication with seditious intent.

title.children: Hong Kong police say mobile phone game violates security law

image.altText: a person holds up a closed fist as someone waves a rainbow pride flag behind them

props.synopsis: While high rates of violence and harassment still affect Australia's LGBTQIA+ Youth, a landmark study has revealed there is a growing focus on joy and support in the community.

title.children: Australia's LGBTQIA+ youth report physical, verbal assault — but also joy

image.altText: Austrian police officers standing at a Graz school

props.synopsis: At least 11 people have died in Austria's deadliest mass shooting in recent history. Here's what we know about how the tragedy unfolded.

title.children: What we know so far about the Austrian school shooting

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile wading into a river, with the sandy bank in the background.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party is proposing new legislation that would allow crocodile culls and safari style hunting trips in Queensland. That bill is currently before a parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: Conservationist Bob Irwin labels crocodile culling 'a pointless exercise'
